verses.verse: (The Deserted City) (Ezra 4.20; Isa 3.26; 54.4; Jer 40.9) How lonely sits the city that once was full of people! How like a widow she has become, she that was great among the nations! She that was a princess among the provinces has become subject to forced labor.

(Ps 6.6; Jer 2.25; 4.30) She weeps bitterly in the night, with tears on her cheeks; among all her lovers, she has no one to comfort her; all her friends have dealt treacherously with her; they have become her enemies.

(Deut 28.64, 65; 2 Kings 25.4, 5; Jer 13.19) Judah has gone into exile with suffering and hard servitude; she lives now among the nations; she finds no resting place; her pursuers have all overtaken her in the midst of her distress.

(Jer 9.11; 10.22; Joel 1.8-13) The roads to Zion mourn, for no one comes to the festivals; all her gates are desolate; her priests groan; her young girls grieve, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) and her lot is bitter.

(Deut 28.43, 44; Jer 30.14, 15; 39.9; 52.28) Her foes have become the masters; her enemies prosper because the LORD has made her suffer for the multitude of her transgressions; her children have gone away, captives before the foe.
(2 Kings 25.4, 5; Jer 13.18) From daughter Zion has departed all her majesty. Her princes have become like stags that find no pasture; they fled without strength before the pursuer.

(Ps 42.4; Isa 5.1-4; Jer 37.7; 48.27; Lam 4.17) Jerusalem remembers (Q ms: MT adds in the days of her affliction and wandering) all the precious things that were hers in days of old. When her people fell into the hand of the enemy and there was no one to help her, the enemy looked on; they mocked over her downfall.

(vv 4, 5, 11, 17, 20, 21, 22|LAM 1:451117202122; 1 Kings 8.46; Jer 13.22, 26) Jerusalem sinned grievously, so she has become a filthy thing; all who honored her despise her, for they have seen her nakedness; she herself groans and turns her face away.

(Deut 32.29; Isa 47.7; Jer 13.17, 18; 16.7; Ezek 24.13) Her uncleanness was in her skirts; she took no thought of her future; her downfall was appalling, with none to comfort her. Look, O LORD, at my affliction, for the enemy has triumphed!

(Deut 23.3; Isa 64.10, 11; Jer 51.51) Enemies have stretched out their hands over all her precious things; she has even seen the nations invade her sanctuary, those whom you forbade to enter your congregation.
(1 Sam 30.12; Jer 38.9; 52.6) All her people groan as they search for bread; they trade their treasures for food to revive their lives. Look, O LORD, and see how worthless I have become.

(v 18|LAM 1:18; Jer 4.8; 18.16; 30.23, 24; 48.27) Is it nothing to you, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) all you who pass by? Look and see if there is any sorrow like my sorrow, which was brought upon me, which the LORD inflicted on the day of his fierce anger.
(Job 19.6; 30.30; Jer 44.6; Hab 3.16) From on high he sent fire; it went deep into my bones; he spread a net for my feet; he turned me back; he has left me stunned, faint all day long.

(Deut 28.48; Isa 47.6; Jer 28.13, 14; 32.3, 5; Ezek 25.4, 7) My transgressions were bound (Meaning of Heb uncertain) into a yoke; by his hand they were fastened together; they weigh on my neck, sapping my strength; the Lord handed me over to those whom I cannot withstand.

(Isa 28.18; 41.2; Jer 13.24; 18.21; Mic 7.10; Rev 14.19) The LORD has rejected all my warriors in the midst of me; he proclaimed a time against me to crush my young men; the Lord has trodden as in a winepress the virgin daughter Judah.

(vv 2, 9|LAM 1:29; Jer 13.17; 14.17; Lam 2.18) For these things I weep; my eyes (Heb my eye, my eye) flow with tears; for a comforter is far from me, one to revive my courage; my children are desolate, for the enemy has prevailed.

(v 8|LAM 1:8; 2 Kings 24.2-4; Jer 4.31) Zion stretches out her hands, but there is no one to comfort her; the LORD has commanded against Jacob that his neighbors should become his foes; Jerusalem has become a filthy thing among them.

(v 12|LAM 1:12; Deut 28.32, 41; 1 Sam 12.14; Jer 12.1) The LORD is in the right, for I have rebelled against his word; but hear, all you peoples, and behold my suffering; my young women and young men have gone into captivity.
(Jer 14.15; 30.14; Lam 2.20) I called to my lovers, but they deceived me; my priests and elders perished in the city while seeking food to revive their lives.

(Deut 32.25; Isa 16.11; Jer 4.19; Lam 2.11; Ezek 7.15) Look, O LORD, at how distressed I am; my stomach churns; my heart is wrung within me because I have been very rebellious. In the street the sword bereaves; in the house it is like death.

(Isa 14.5, 6; Jer 30.16; Lam 2.15) They heard how I was groaning, with no one to comfort me. All my enemies heard of my trouble; they are glad that you have done it. Bring on the day that you have announced, and let them be as I am.
(Neh 4.4, 5; Ps 137.7, 8) Let all their evildoing come before you, and deal with them as you have dealt with me because of all my transgressions; for my groans are many, and my heart is faint.
